answers.answer: The echo results mean that you heart's pumping function is normal.If you were diagnosed with CHF, that may be due to what they call diastolic CHF (in simple works, your heart is a bit to stiff,  maybe from high blood pressure, diabetes etc....). If you are young then the diagnosis of CHF is probably incorrect, since most of young people get CHF only if EF is down (or they have some very rare diseases).I hope that helps

An EF in that range is basically "normal", your heart vales looked fine and no regional wall motion abnormalities means no ischaemia.They are all good things.Was you diagnosis made based on your symptoms?I hope you are feeling well.
CHF with an EF of 60-65%?  I'm confused.

question: i was recently dianosed w/ CHF  while reading my discharge summary, i ran across a sentence that said an echo was obtain that showed an ef of 60-65% with no regional wall motion abnormalties and normal valves.  what does this mean  in layman terms?
title: Echo results
